i agree with you as a roblox player since i have seen the change of roblox turning more into a cash grab platform if you did not know back in the early days of roblox there used to be a nd roblox currency known as tix every player got tix every day as a daily log in reward and could get more tix by place visits in which you got tix for every visitor the user could of spent tix to buy items in the catalog and could trade tix for robux using the **roblex** trade system sadly in roblox removed tix making everything now require robux this the where the modern day problem that you have stated comes into effect sadly the people who run roblox seem to not care anymore since now they make more money from people buying robux the only way to see if roblox really wants to change this is if a tix like system returns which will sadly most likely never happen again

all of this just for robux dang the value of robux compare to the us dollar is continuing inflating every time someone buys robux the only reason why it hasn't inflated to the point of it being post wwi germany is this thing called tax where roblox the corporation receives of all robux transaction and whenever someone buys a item created by roblox with robux the only way of obtaining robux legally is buying roblox premium because it offers more then buying regular robux but the pricing is expensive enough where someone can't just buy over robux without spending usd only reason why someone would do this is if they are investing in limited items but that's another topic but too expensive where you not really getting your money worth if you don't buy premium anyways all games die at some point and some game devs milk the same cow trying to make as much robux without much more work and with tax on purchases that affects games dev robux income they add new stuff maybe change visual mostly small changes called it insert game name create the game and milk the same cow to make robux and because its a new game the gamepass are incompatible so if a dev makes a net total of k robux off the game that's because of the gross income gets taxes which in this example k robux they can also exchange robux to usd on a special rate and on a special program called devex but thats another topic obviously they can only exchange their net robux income made from the game i have no clue if the game devs are greedy but its a economic reason of why these things happen its it a good reason most likely not buts its a reason as regards to economics of roblox if a game dev really want to make robux and have a stable income is to just update their one game instead of creating a copy of it slap a number on it and call it a day

it's unfortunate to hear that your sons were tricked but i suppose it's better for them to learn this lesson now than later in regards to your question [i recommend contacting the roblox customer service] if you are unable to recover via email it's important to note though that ~~if~~ the customer service representative working with you approves your sons' accounts for a restoration such as if items robux were taken out of the accounts they will only do so once for an account; this means that if either of your sons' accounts are compromised in the future regardless of losing a significant amount more or less of items robux they will be ineligible for an item robux restoration they will however be eligible for assistance in retrieving a compromised account likewise customer support has a day limit on item currency restorations although the link doesn't explicitly mention this users on this subreddit have reported past successes in recovering accounts if they made purchases on them with this in mind i recommend keeping your payment information on standby but not providing anything unless asked i hope that this helps as a final note this subreddit is community moderated and is not affiliated with roblox i am not a roblox employee and all the information that i provided is based solely on information that i have read over the years; my comment regarding payment information may or may not be applicable today however the link i provided comes directly from roblox and *should* be correct good luck

roblox games on xbox can use a button to scam players out of robux twice recently my daughter lost robux unexpectedly playing a game on the xbox version after doing some research it appears to be down to specifically how the xbox version of roblox maps controller buttons by default i believe the a button is mapped to jump & confirm so when a dialog pops up e g purchase this in game item the a button is used to confirm the purchase when a game like an obby makes a lot of use of jump and also includes in game purchases this creates a situation where accidental purchases are super easy so easy that while my daughter was carefully trying to show me what happened without triggering the purchases she accidentally triggered the purchase i've reached out to roblox customer support about this and so far they've been extremely unhelpful their position is summarised as * they can't or won't refund robux * issues in games are the developers responsibility * developers can't refund robux * tell the developer because we're sure they'd want to fix it i don't believe this is a developer issue though if the default for games on xbox has the a button mapped to two operations maybe a developer could remap i don't know as i'm not a roblox dev but regardless this is very much a roblox issue and one they should address and refund on [ here's another great example [ **update** i've had four different customer support folks from roblox contact me the first three repeated the mantra above the fourth basically referred me back to those messages and said they can't help me any further

hi welcome to the sub there's a few possibilities but here's a guess her account password was weak and it got guessed she downloaded something that 'keylogged' her password possibly she knew the password and accidentally fell for a phishing scam this is unlikely by what you stated but i'm leaving this as a possibility ___ first of all i highly recommend you to set up security settings on her account **enable two factor authentication** **pin** through [settings] you can enable a separate pin inside of your account settings to prevent unwanted changes to your account settings **more secure password** secure passwords are difficult to guess have long lengths with mixes of capital letters and uncommon keys e g @# ^*& you can also use a [password manager] to handle your passwords for both your roblox account and other sites **never give away your account details ** there is almost no situation where you can reasonably give away your account details roblox staff will never need access to your account always check frequently when clicking links whether you are on the official roblox website www roblox com before entering any account details **beware of off site downloads** off site downloads can contain malicious content which steals your account details be wary when downloading anything from untrusted sources especially sketchy forums promising 'free' or 'paid' cheats hacks for games this includes browser extensions ___ aside from that roblox has a ton of security options that should prevent this in the future above are the examples fa pin etc which would make it much easier there's also an option on the settings to log out anyone that isn't your device computer in the settings panel you can also contact roblox support for help if you have any questions feel free to ask we get a lot of parents on the sub who are confused on what to do and most of us are happy to help
enable two step verification in settings there is nothing else you can do but thankfully that should be enough

it's very likely that you have a keylogger on your computer uninstall suspicious software if you have to run virus scans dont download virus scanning software though use windows defender then change the password and enable two step verification this will force you to have to enter a text code that's sent to you by email every time your child logs in or every thirty days depending on which setting you pick once you've updated all account info report the owner of the shirt on site and email roblox support including that users username once the message is sent to support it may take around hours to get feedback however it's very likely that your child will get the robux back if you want i'm totally down to give you triple the amount your daughter lost tell her to not worry and that everything will likely be restored soon

hello there something like this has happened to me before on the th of july my roblox account was hacked by someone unknown they purchased robux on my account i knew that because when i checked my robux the balance was up to to later on i accessed roblox again and saw that my account was deleted for unauthorized disputed charges i emailed roblox support as quick as possible some hours later i received a reply saying that my appeal has been sent to a billing specialist who will be able to assist me further after days of waiting i finally received a reply from a billing specialist saying that my appeal has been denied when i read the message i was completely clueless since ”one or more of the purchases made to this account were reported as disputed unauthorized by the card owner through google play “ i had absolutely no idea what that meant since the card holder is clearly me what i assumed happened is that the hacker purchased robux on my account with a different card so roblox saw the charges is unauthorized and terminated my account the question is how did they assume such a strong password the hacker could have possibly keylogged my roblox account after some weeks later i finally received another message from roblox saying that my account has been unbanned later on i activated step verificafion so something like this won’t happen again i also forgot to mention that the hacker left a message on my account ”this is what you get “

mistake by trusting a stranger and giving away either his access codes password pin etc through a phishing site or bluntly stating it out to them downloading something that contained a virus or having an easily guessable password and not having two factor authentication or anything of the sort enabled **and how do they allow these scammers on their game to steal from kids ** they do not but it's a game of cat and mouse many online games game platforms tend to have people who want to scam because there's typically someone who's scummy enough to do so roblox has a large younger playerbase who i also recommend that you enable other security settings so that it's harder for people who somehow end up with the password can't access it in the security settings you can set a parental pin it's basically a backup password inside of the options menu so that nothing can be changed without it you can also set up two step authentication with a verified email address for the extra bit basically it'll make anyone who tries to login have to get a code that is sent to your email so in that case only you would be able to access it

personally in my opinion devex is what actually made roblox worse for me here are some of my thoughts * devex could be the root cause of clothing spam bots before devex robux was just an in game only token with no real world value now that robux is worth real money with devex people have more motivation than ever to exploit the flawed system talented people have spent time making these bots and fight to keep them running there wouldn't be real life benefit to clothes botting if robux didn't have real value * while devex can reward great developers it does motivate some devs into optimizing their game for maximum profit sometimes by using bad monetization tactics like those that op mentioned games are more likely to be more of the same with big colorful shop button as if shop is the # button players want to interact the most with or a timer pressuring me to buy the limited time starter pack when i first played a game before i even know if the game is going to be enjoyable for me or if the pack is really a good value * while devex let people do things they enjoy it could also attract profit driven tycoons who only cares about profit who make game just because money * before devex one person made games at least have some chance of getting to the front pages now that there are professional teams and studios that are formed to make everything more efficient one person games have practically a little chance; no longer that side projects made just for fun can get popular use money to make money now apply even if you don't intend to earn money * optimizing to appeal to the most player as possible can result in monoculture in the long term games can become more bland and or more of the same overtime look at the devhunt and some could argue even ; so many participating games are absolutely optimized to the max for maximum profits and play time without considering players' enjoyment while also putting in as little effort and creativity it as possible some even used psychological tricks to get you to buy things roblox could do better in quality control but i think if devex isn't here these devhunts could be at least a bit more bearable now i understand that there's no going back now as much as i want them to people have already made roblox development their main job and i absolutely do not want to ruin anyone's living on this planet earth changes of the devex kind is simply irreversible and i understand it i'm not protesting for devex to be removed i just want to express my thoughts this is just my opinion i can be wrong but things like this have at least for me ruined youtube in the recent years; now that people have taken youtube as a job many have to obey the algorithm just to make a rent many censor themselves because they don't want to risk being demonetized videos that should be shorter are stretched to \~ min for maximum ad revenue clickbait are used to lure in the most views some creators sacrifice quality just to pump out new videos every day then there are tycoons churning out inappropriate and uncreative cartoons because they're lured in by money some now even openly admits to using clickbait after being called out but ultimately shrugged it as it's just business yes roblox and youtube is not the same but devex have already made an impact for better or for worse it seems everything is all about money now and i mean only and purely about money and yes this monetization schemes did bring more production value to both roblox games and youtube videos but i find that it's getting harder to find enjoyable roblox games or youtube videos that respect my time after these schemes take place for me production value doesn't always mean it's going to be enjoyable i'm also very sorry for the long reply these are just my opinion

i think the easiest way to explain it is roblox isn't a game on its own but rather similar to steam where it hosts a ton of games made by independent developers 'robux' is basically used as a middle man currency to purchase stuff in different games let's say there are two games phantom forces and apocalypse rising both have their own 'ingame' currency that they use which is purchasable with robux neither have any direct connection as far as i'm aware of so nothing purchased in one game works in the other for gears there are a lot of stuff that you can purchase on roblox's official catalog **this is purely cosmetic** most if not nearly every game on the platform does not support roblox's own official gears because it wouldn't work with their games well they have little control over the balance of it and yeah there are some games on the site they disappear fairly quickly though that show up as scams generally it's easy to tell for the average user giant screen blocking microtransactions everywhere and generally poor quality games but for a kid not so much unfortunately there are some games that have items specifically only for one session usually they'll specify it in their descriptions before someone purchases the item some devs have twitters usually they block off their mail on the roblox site since they tend to get swarmed with mail if they open it up that you can reach out to them or discords hope that helps

the only way to gain access to someone's account on roblox is by directly receiving the users password from the user in other words there is absolutely no way to hack the roblox website and get access to a random players password some if the ways this hacker gets access to the account are •phishing they make a scam website usually promising to give free items in game and requiring to log in with the player's login info on their website this basically means the player was fooled to directly give the hacker his info •becoming friends with the player thru the inter web or in real life and asking for login info •player accidentally reveals login info •there is malware in the players computer usually caused by clicking unknown links that has a keylogger records each one of the player keystrokes hence said the only way a hacker can gain access to your boys' accounts are by directly receiving their login info

my dad had a rule for me growing up that if i wanted to spend my money on something i had to have at least double the cost of the item so i didn’t go broke from buying it so in this case i would need to have saved up before i could buy the roblox skin this practice taught me to view money very differently and i still use it to this day for splurges and non necessities as an added bonus often by the time i had the money saved up for whatever it was i wanted i no longer wanted it so possibly introduce something like this to your daughter definitely explain to her that dlc like this is designed to be addictive and tell her that you want to make sure she’s fully thought this through because you don’t want her to spend all of her money on roblox another idea would be to show her how much really is show her how many starbucks drinks or chipotle burritos she could buy with that money show her how many hours she would have to work at minimum wage to make that money back is a lot of money but kids have little understanding of that before they start working

gaming parent here with possibly a hot take but here goes nothing let her spend that money on the stupid skin i think we as adults have to understand that this obviously is predatory and shouldn’t be allowed but our kids don’t see that they don’t get the predatory nature of it until it’s effecting them so i say let them experience it that’ll be the hardest lesson on money ever when she realizes what the value of that actually is and i totally agree with everyone else in this thread all of them are being good responsible parents but you have a kid that isn’t letting go of this idea you can show them all of the other things can get them but all they want is the skin so let them have it then once they regret it you’ll look them in the face and say “well that is what buyers remorse is and that’s why i was trying to get you to understand the value of the you just spent” this is personally the lesson my dad gave me i spent a bunch of my hard earned money on some stupid ass facebook game i think it was called mafia town or something my dad tried his damn hardest to get me to see reason but ultimately i chose to spend my money and boy oh boy did i regret that purchase once my friends started to move onto instagram i learned a lesson that day and clearly your kid needs it to so as much as it hurts you to watch them blow that money let them do it it’ll be the most expensive lesson they’ll ever learn and i promise you they won’t make it again

i'd say no several reasons it's your job to teach financial responsibilities your job to set boundaries falling for scams is a boundary don't support the scammer but before you say no perhaps you can change her perspective by reframing stuff like this as an actual scam explain to her that the person selling that is a bad person who is trying to rob people who don't know better how scammers try to find people dumb enough to fall for their scams so they can get free money without working reinforce that she is smart and she's not going to fall for their lies she's too smart to give them the money she's worked for all that said there's something to be said for making mistakes while she's got a safety net better to get scammed now when she won't starve than later in life *if* you decide to let her make the mistake you can reinforce it by making her feel it make her handle the in cash when she goes to buy physical robux cards you decide if a stack of smaller bills or bills will impact her more not sure if robux cards have sales tax but don't cover that for her either let her see the opportunity cost if she really wants something special tell her she can chip in if she has the money otherwise you'll buy the basic version i'm thinking luxury clothes or an iphone vs an inexpensive feature phone if you go to the movies if she wants popcorn she's gotta pay for it herself lunch money nah you'll buy groceries so she can bring lunch in if she wants a school lunch she can pay for that on her own you can even do that last one now tell her that if she saves up for her skin she can have it in december or whenever in the meantime set her expectations that you will expose her to how all the little perks of her life cost money let her know how you feel about the waste of money and that you won't stop her but she will have to forgo those perks to get what she wants since you need to save money in order to pay her not saying let her needs go unmet or to go overboard but expose her to natural consequences of making financial decisions
introduce her to factorio and play together or teach her how to make her own skins and make money from her viewers

hell to the no my teen son and daughters want to buy fortnight bux and robux respectively the answer is almost always no they use their allowance for the 'subscription' plan those games offer that comes with in game currency they need to learn to save those to buy the thing they want unfortunately the games weaponise fomo with limited releases enter the fortnite bejeweled pick axe it's my money why can't i spend it we let my son write out what the extra dollars would buy him what sort of entertainment would that buy him he went with a movie ticket and a soda that would last him hours max while he'll have this pickaxe forever trying to explain the difference between a subscription that supports the game and grants him items he knows will be included vs the limited time items is hard in the end we said he could do this 'once' that we don't want him to get hooked on the it's just addiction that he needs to know they're manipulating him we'll see if he remembers the agreement

ooooh the headless horseman debate lol my yo daughter and i just had this convo a few days ago we also game together are roblox players and are very aware of this weird “headless” fascination now it’s so popular that kids are creating “fake headless” regularly now and this avatar isn’t even a new one crazy how it’s kept grown its popularity over time this is a tough one and it really depends on things imo what kind of parental controls you want to put on how your daughter spends her money and how much you want to encourage continued time and effort in gaming and her yt channel for us that amt of money is just too much for an avatar for a casual gamer however she actually did say to me that she could understand and justify that large purchase if she was a yter and posted vids like yours and had a substantial following we discussed it like an investment for someone trying to grow their youtube channel gaming experience sounds silly when referring to roblox i know but this is what kids do now and many kids look at this as a pathway to their future becoming influencers or gamers who post vids or a future in gaming development software prog coding etc this is what mine currently wants to do id say that if this headless purchase is something she’s been working towards with the intention of it helping to grow her yt gamer following and subscribers maybe let her do it esp if she’s still got another month before she earns the last if she’s still dead set on it id support it tbh it’s not much different than tween teens saving for that special “name brand” ____ or a new bike or computer accessory or whatever granted an avatar isn’t a tangible item but if that’s what your kid is into and they’ve worked to save up for it themselves… maybe have her make a list of what she’d spend her money on if the headless horseman was taken off the table is there anything else that she may have regrets about if she spent all her money on an avatar id definitely make them think on it for a while but yours seems to have done this and is continuing to do so as she earns the last of it she also seems to be making a name for herself and is pretty dedicated if her gaming and youtube channel is something you see continuing indefinitely and growing and you support her doing it i’d let her do it worst case scenario she has regrets later but the silver lining here is that she learns the invaluable lesson of how saving and spending your savings is such an important decision not to be taken lightly that will be ever present throughout life and whether she spends it on the avatar or something else she will also learn that building up your savings again like that isn’t easy and that could also help grow her appreciation for what it takes to save money and spend it wisely

yeh i wouldn’t allow it either i essentially put a ban on roblox in our household around a year ago for the same reasons people here have already mentioned in particular the predatory nature of the game fyi i have a yr old boy and a yr old daughter although i will say it’s great that she’s working her but off to save up she’s obviously got drive and dedication to get what she wants around a year ago i took notice of my kids not really having the autonomy to do what they wanted with their money and spend it the way we do as adults which is mostly online these days amazon they essentially had to wait for us to go on a trip to target or another big box store often they would forget they had money saved up all together especially if it was accumulated from gifts and sometimes we would forget too this also led me to the realization that money as an incentive was losing its power for my kids if i said i’ll give you a dollar to clean up the mess in the playroom they weren’t really motivated at all because they couldn’t really do much with it they had to rely on us for our schedule travel and then ultimately our review and approval before spending it on something long story short i started designing and prototyping an app platform around the concepts of autonomy for kids chores allowance money management and kids shopping essentially i’ve connected a money management and chores app for parents with a kid friendly and fully curated shopping platform for kids i’ve just opened it up for beta testers if anyone is interested it giving it a whirl please shoot me a dm

i would try to reframe the situation to teach her how to handle money in general you should talk to her about how of any money she earns should be saved and invested for her future put it in a savings account to start earning interest eventually getting into index funds try to get her excited about the idea of money earning money the purpose of this is to get her started on the path to financial freedom and independence she should also budget around of her money towards charities the purpose being to teach her that money can should be used as a tool to help others the money that's left over she can use however she wants even if it's something that we might consider stupid or self indulgent everyone has a right to pursue happiness i know grown adults that spend money on stupid things like watches and cars so the impulse to spend money on stupid things is never going to go away but if you can get her to stick to those lessons of savings investing and donating then that will be worth millions of dollars to her over her lifetime and it won't ever really matter if she spent on something stupid

my daughter f was big into roblox for a while she spent a ton of her money on it so i am familiar with this i have a slightly different take but it probably wont be very helpful for you at this exact moment first just because they're not getting anything physical for their money doesnt mean its not important or worth it kids and adults spend lots of money on unnecessary physical items that end up getting discarded and never return that value to themselves she also has a yt channel so this is likely contributing to her content which could eventually be monetized ok now all that said i would not let her spend if it was all of her money that she had saved for a long time the lesson here is that some of her allowance bday money should be automatically saved every time she receives it this is how adults should be handling their money as well if you implement this prior to the desire to spend big then it doesnt matter what she spends it on because shes already got savings covered

would you let your kid spend their money on a ponzi scheme if they really really wanted to would you let them order worth of infomercial snake oil would you let them shop amazon or ebay or alibaba on their own and drop on a counterfeit item would you let them develop a gambling habit and say “well it’s their chores money… if they want to gamble it away that’s on them ” come on it’s your job to guide and raise this child into adulthood well equipped to take on the challenges of life these games and their micro transactions are *known* to be addictive and habit forming much like gambling a child has no business being on there **at all** let alone being allowed to participate in real money exchanges in a game they won’t learn a lesson from this they’ll sink deeper into delusion and addiction just like countless adults do when they place their biggest bet yet or buy their biggest haul yet or take their biggest hit yet

if she worked hard for it then it’s her money to spend you may think it’s frivolous and means nothing but for someone who really enjoys the game it can mean the entire world to them someone else had recently said something similar not long ago and i think the problem the both of y’all have is that it’s not something you can physically hold therefore it’s meaningless because you deem it meaningless there will be plenty of stuff in the future that your child will buy that you will think are stupid or worthless that could make them happy if the dollars is used up then that it she’ll have to earn more money for whatever she wants next perhaps along the way she’ll regret buying that dollar headless because she’ll want something else i think that’s the natural way to go about it rather than controlling the money she worked for i remember i worked hard for an ipod touch when i was about that was bucks and my folks were so against it because they didn’t see the value in it like i did and i was heart broken because it made no sense as to work for something yet have restrictions on what i could buy with the money i earned so when i got a little older and got a job i bought exactly what they didn’t want me to buy

when my daughter was she had her heart set on a pos used car i had agreed to match funds and it would have taken all her savings plus mine to buy something that wouldn’t last i had to say no she was angry at me for a couple of months eventually we found a car that we both agreed upon and it got her through her college years you can teach the lesson of “wasting your money has consequences” and let her suffer those consequences or you can guide her some other way personally i went to work at and spent on a lot of junk that only made me happy for a moment and i wish someone had taught me that impulse buys aren’t as satisfying in the long run than saving

my mum encouraged me to get a credit card at the bank would send me a pre approved limit increase every couple of months i became addicted to a free to play mmorpg as a means of escape from my life this was almost twenty years ago when micro transactions were far less predatory before i knew it i had thousands in credit card debt they main method to encourage spending was to offer prizes for spending over certain amounts or if you were able to acquire an extremely rare item offered for a limited time from a loot box i heard of some people that would spend over k just trying for one item putting a hard boundary about these highly predatory practices is a good thing this includes gambling limit time or just generally insanely overpriced items that push the fomo impulse buying onto kids personally i hate any gambling based product aimed at kids including the countless blind box loot box toys that now seem to make up the majority of toy advertisements these days also please be extremely vigilant with who your child is communicating with a friend of mine recently told me about their niece whom is about the same age and like your daughter makes regular roblox videos it was discovered that she was in regular contact with a man in his s that she'd met through roblox he had even gotten her to install a chat program on her phone to help hide what was going on these predatory high priced gambling based mechanics offer predators the perfect method to groom victims simply by gifting items or pre paid vouchers please please please be careful

what is her reasoning for wanting it i think my answer would still be no but my approach would change depending on why she wants it it might not be impulse driven it could be mom this item is big right now and would increase the amount of views i receive in which case it’s an investment and possibly a wise business strategy in this case i would bring up roi and explain that her content would need to be generating revenue to be a worthwhile investment “my friends will think i’m so cool” would be a completely different approach “because i saw another content creator using it and i like it so much” would be a completely different approach her “why” is equally important as the item she wants i would personally guide her towards creating her own skins that she can possibly one day monetize what i really want to stress though is that of you’re going to say no be sure to be up front about that now before she reaches that nothing is more demotivating and is wicked at killing a good work ethic and saving attitude than letting her build up to that and then telling her she can’t buy the skin she sounds very driven and the ability to save for a future desire is a really awesome skill that many adults don’t have my main reason for the no would honestly be the income to cost ratio more than anything else people spend money on collectibles concerts etc that many other people just don’t see the value in if when she’s making enough money that the purchase doesn’t empty the bank account i would personally be ok with it even though the value isn’t worth it to me personally i’m not sure what that number would look like for most people for me the purchase would have to be like of total income max

i'm a financial educator specialising in people with executive function issues aka neurodivergent people and basically all children recently ran a workshop on exactly this let me know if you want the details i'd say let her do it what she wants to spend money on isn't harmful or illegal it's not going to hurt her or anyone else it's far better for her to learn about making mistakes and being suckered by advertising now while wasting her money doesn't mean potentially losing her home or having bailiffs at the door she might be delighted by her pixels and genuinely feel it was worth it people like odd things i have never understood many of the things people spend money on she is more likely to regret her choice when something else comes along and she can't afford it separate out the issues if you want her to save a percentage of her money for her longer term future make that rule going forwards but don't apply it retrospectively it will backfire and make her less likely to save at the same time consider whether there are any things you could make her responsible for paying for out of her own money it sound like she's actually potentially going to be able to monetise her youtube hobby have you talked to her about whether that's the plan she'll need guidance and supervision but it could be that she knows this specific skin will be worthwhile investing in i don't know enough about roblox to know but i bet she does

honestly i think you should let her spend *her* money how *she* wants to all of us have made a bad purchase or two taught us all important lessons

my mother would “hold” my birthday chore allowance family gift money for me so i wouldn’t lose it okay i understand you don’t want a year old having cash and losing it but the problem is whenever i would want to buy a new toy or something i would ask my mom if i could have some of my money to buy something she would than respond by telling me all of my money was spent because she took us out to the movies or dinner a few weeks ago basically she would hold my brothers and my money spend it all and than justify it being gone for some random dinner or bowling or something we had no agreement on she did this every single time for years so as i got older and started working i didn’t save anything i would spend the dollar i got the second i got money because i was taught “saving money gets you nothing” it took me almost my whole twenties to correct this behavior and i think it was due in part by mother stealing our money and never seeing any reward for being patient so yeah let her spend it just because it’s not important to you doesn’t mean it’s not important to her also for bonus points say “since you did such a good job saving your money i wanna match half the cost so you get to save the remaining for the next thing you want” let her buy it this one is easy

i've been gaming since forever and i can't stand that gaming like so many other facets of our lives now revolves around constant fees and subscriptions and even worse the vaporware that is in game skins it does nothing for gameplay nothing and people buy that useless stuff thowaway fashion for video games that said our kids get on birthdays and christmas to spend however they would like on their video games they've learned very quickly how fast the money goes and what they're really getting in return they still enjoy getting the occasional skin for their character whether it be roblox or whatever but they'd much rather spend the money on a new game or actual dlc expansions for the games they have if she was earning on her videos then she could spend that on the skin however asking you to pay for a zero return investment like this is not cool at all this would be a hard no in our house this would also be a great time to start discussing how to make money herself is she wants to have big expenditures like this for personal items

i’m sorry im a new parent but i have nieces and nephews of roblox age i feel like the conversation of why in game cosmetic purchases that don’t even affect play are an absolute waste is an important conversation to have what do you get from spending real money on this absolutely nothing you can still play the game in all aspects i play magic the gathering which isn’t a cheap hobby i’ll spend however much i want within reason maybe a year on physical cards because a you need them to play with them b they can and usually do increase in value over time and c it’s an asset in a sense i can trade them for other cards or sell them if i’m ever in a tight financial spot but i refuse to pay a dime for cards in the app version because i’m not getting anything real from it it’s a teachable moment regarding responsible spending habits you want to buy worth of in game money so you can buy things that either allow you to play more of that game or get more out of the game and it’s something you enjoy then go for it it’s ok to spend reasonable amounts of money on entertainment but to pay for what is just a cosmetic upgrade is absurd i don’t care if it is their money you’re the parent your job is to guide them teach them how not to fall victim to scams which is absolutely is teach them what is and is not worth spending money on and why it’s greedy and morally wrong on roblox’s part to even charge that much for something like that because you’re putting thousands of parents in an uncomfortable position where if they don’t pay this absurd amount for this inherently valueless thing their kid is going to be mad at them

my take is that it is our job as parents to teach our kids how to judge value and how to determine if something is a waste of money i found this scam and many others in roblox i had long discussion with both of my kids about the unethical practices in this game they still play it on occasion but we all decided it was for the best to never put money into it again in short you should absolutely be giving final approval for any purchases your kids make until they have proved that they are capable of being good stewards of their money her asking to spend this much money on a roblox skin just proves that she is not have her write a formal request form or business proposal listing why this is a good use of the funds should be an interesting read

i would suggest you sit down with her and show just how much money is i don't think she understands the worth of money very well yet and is gullible to fall for this type of scam and will again if you don't teach her otherwise show her other things that are worth that interest her maybe a full day trip to an amusement park with the quick pass how many clothes from high end brands how many trips to the ice cream store new tech anything that has and keeps the worth you are paying for; books antiques collectibles rare game merch and for the record if i learned that my brothers used up for some bullshit videogame detail i'd definitely smack them upside the head it stupid and disrespectful to the person and work put in to earn that money

just my opinion worth what it cost you it's her money you've tried to reason with her but she wants the skin so let her buy it you've probably wasted money on things that made you happy too we only get to do this trip through life once that anyone is sure of so treat yourself when you can afford it without penalty or pain i think you're doing all the right things despite your distress at the situation which i would feel as well for the record if i was in your shoes i would do exactly what you're doing have the talk explain yourself explain why you disagree with her plans and if she ignores the input let her spend her money on what she wants that said be aware that despite the arguments against allowing this based on the potential for microtransaction purchasing to become addicting barring your child from spending their money on what they want could simply lead to more impulsive behavior when they are no longer under your care have you tried showing her what else that's more material or valuable she could spend the money on

as someone who has studied cognitive psychology and has spent years doing user experience design for a living my professional assessment is that most free to play games like roblox are highly manipulative at best and straight up unethical at worst there is no age at which these types of games are appropriate even most adults don't have the training to recognize all the different ways that they're being manipulated let alone have practiced strategies for overcoming social conditioning needed to resist robert cialdini has written a lot in cognitive psychology about what he's deemed principles of persuasion which are general techniques that are used to influence people's behavior here's a brief summary of the principles [ his book influence is a good read if you want to dig in a little deeper [ applying some of them to a common pattern you'll see in these types of games * if you login every day you get a free reward * sets the stage for exploiting **reciprocity** \ because they did something nice for you your instinct is going to be to do something for them by complying with what they're asking * the reward gets better each consecutive day you play * exploits **consistency** \ if you've convinced someone to do something once they're far more likely to keep doing it * the rewards reset if you miss a day * exploits **scarcity** \ when something is taken away even if it's free people instinctively perceive the cost of the loss as greater than what the item would have cost to acquire * after you get the bonus you'll presented with a limited offer to purchase something only available to the first x players y players have already redeemed * exploits **scarcity** \ seeing that it's limited makes it appear more valuable and drives instinct to acquire something before it runs out * exploits **social proof** \ seeing that a large number of others have taken the offer makes you more likely to consider it a good idea to do as well * exploits **reciprocity** \ you're far more likely to take an offer because they've given you rewards single player games that cost real money are almost always a better choice as others have noted nintendo has a lot of great options but there are many for pc xbox and ps ps as well

as someone who has studied cognitive psychology and has spent years doing user experience design for a living my professional assessment is that most free to play games like roblox are highly manipulative at best and straight up unethical at worst **there is no age at which these types of games are appropriate even most adults don't have the training to recognize all the different ways that they're being manipulated let alone have practiced strategies for overcoming social conditioning needed to resist ** robert cialdini has written a lot in cognitive psychology about what he's deemed principles of persuasion which are general techniques that are used to influence people's behavior here's a brief summary of the principles [ his book influence is a good read if you want to dig in a little deeper [ applying some of them to a common pattern you'll see in these types of games * if you login every day you get a free reward * sets the stage for exploiting reciprocity because they did something nice for you your instinct is going to be to do something for them by complying with what they're asking * the reward gets better each consecutive day you play * exploits consistency if you've convinced someone to do something once they're far more likely to keep doing it * the rewards reset if you miss a day * exploits scarcity when something is taken away even if it's free people instinctively perceive the cost of the loss as greater than what the item would have cost to acquire * after you get the bonus you'll presented with a limited offer to purchase something only available to the first x players y players have already redeemed * exploits scarcity seeing that it's limited makes it appear more valuable and drives instinct to acquire something before it runs out * exploits social proof seeing that a large number of others have taken the offer makes you more likely to consider it a good idea to do as well * exploits reciprocity you're far more likely to take an offer because they've given you rewards single player games that cost real money are almost always a better choice

try to get a refund you need to treat the stealing and the spending differently the spending needs more of a life lesson than a punishment the stealing needs punishment though you need to make sure he understands how utterly disappointed you are that he did that and how wrong it is to steal if possible reach out to a friend or family member that has the opportunity to make him do a day's worth of work i own a business and have tons of shitty chores that would be fine for a yo that needs to learn about hard work and the value of money have him spend a saturday with someone you know who has a business a farm a large yard that needs work an elderly relative that could use someone to carry their groceries and do chores a garage that needs to be cleaned out etc and preferably let him start early then use the commenters tip who advices to calculate for him how many of those days he'd have to work to make back take him grocery shopping explain that money that is spend on one thing can't be spend on something else he spend so now you need to save not buying the phone he was gonna get is a good start the remaining amount needs to come out of the grocery budget that might mean no snacks this week no soda no brand cereal whatever would drive the point home for him explain to him what he saved and why that's necessary this might mean your yo also doesn't get her favorite groceries but this isn't a punishment it's a lesson and that lesson is useful for both of them sit him down and explain how stealing is one of the worst things you can do he betrayed your trust and that makes you upset and disappointed he needs to think of a way to make it up to his dad but he's also grounded for *whatever amount of time you'd think is appropriate* he's also not allowed any screentime when he's grounded and will only get that privilege back if he was well behaved during the time he was grounded and made an effort to apologize to his dad

if you can't undo it you might pivot it into a learning experience say you work hrs a day and make in weeks he has school for ish hrs of actual class time have him do extra hrs of math practice and handwriting for two weeks it's work and it takes a lot of work to build k and having an internalized appreciation for that can help him make better value decisions in the future

this is the difference between a debit card and a credit card the legal protections on both are somewhat similar but the reality is different you can dispute charges on your debit card but the money is already gone from your account and the money will remain gone from your account unless the bank resolves the challenge in your favor with a credit card a disputed transaction is permanently on hold and you don't owe the money to the bank until the transaction is resolved this is a decent reason why you should have a credit card for online purchases even if you prefer to run a primarily cash household

> > if this is like the dog walkers i see walking like dogs at once in a maze of leashes that walker is making bank they might be the problem with dog walking as a business is the logistics if you can find dogs in the same suburb to walk all of them at the same time you can make bank for sure but remember that walk has to last an hour form pickup to drop off and you need to pick up and drop off all those dogs so the reality is that dogs going for walk is just about a full day's work when you account for all the time overhead and that assumes that you can find customers that all live close enough together that you can do the walk as group for walks means a walk dogs a day means a day now that's assuming that you actually have enough customers to do days work a week that above example is only walks a week so if we assume you're only working days a week it's a week from there you'd need to pay taxes like a small business before you'd pay yourself there's not a lot of expenses in dog walking so you don't get a ton of deductions most dog walking businesses acquire customers just through social media it's often a who you know kind of operation so there might be some facebook ads that you'd need to run and staying on top of all the customer communications will be a pain in the ass even if you have a stable group of customers there's bound to be some churn so you always need to be hustling for that next customer having said all that k a week for a job that you really only need to work days a week is decently good there's just not a lot of room to grow that business above a person operation

we just had to have the conversation again with my yo she came to the bank of dad asking for bucks of gas money to make it to payday bank of dad required her to produce an analysis of her spending over the last month and to explain why she didn’t have gas money i already knew since i have access to her bank account but she needed to go through the motions of understanding where the money went and then we sat down with her and asked her to figure out how much gas she needed every week to make it to work what that would cost with a fudge factor for additional driving around town and variability in the price of gas and to determine how much money she had left to spend on whatever and letting her know that when the car insurance renews she’s on the hook for hers going forward and then once she did all that getting a loan is a lot of paperwork after all we then negotiated the terms of the payday loan and how much the vig was gonna be she was gonna have to mow the lawn and do some extra chores on top of paying back the principal which is a pretty usurious vig when you think about it but it’s much better for these lessons to be learned budgeting not blowing all your money on twitch what a terrible idea payday loans are how much money adulting costs why doordash is a stupid idea when you’re just sitting at home craving a box of mcfries etc when the stakes are a tank of gas rather than when they’re “not being able to make rent or the power bill” or “guido is threatening to come break your legs because you didn’t pay the loan”

my philosophy is allowance is to help my kids learn to spend money in ways that align with their values i want them to practice spending money on things so they get the experience of feeling like it was totally worth it and it totally wasn't i want them to learn to save up for things they want that's big and to donate to charity they believe in we force a split of save spend and give after that it's their money

i'm a gamer but i'm pretty much against buying cosmetics for games on the other hand i'm old and i know this is stuff kids are into i remind myself that it's not really different than buying accessories for toys the main difference means it's not another toy taking up space they will get bored with

nope i also hate it but it's their money if they want to use their planning and self control to learn how to get closer to something they want it would be kinda mean of me to try to control what they spend it on like what would be their motivation or what would they learn at that point if they're not even going to be able to get what they are working towards plus an added bonus if they don't have the money for the thing they want to buy then there's no reason to bother me with any begging they don't ask me for anything they want anymore i pay allpwance over cashapp my older two have cashapp cards and can check their balances on their phones and i use the savings account on my cashapp to keep up with my youngest son's balance

my perspective on allowance is that the purpose is to teach kids how to manage their money kids will be adults someday and adults make big choices with money that could have bid consequences letting kids make choices with their allowance even bad choices is giving them a chance to learn while the risks are low they can choose how to spend their money especially at this age with out the risk of ending up without food transportation utilities or housing instead i restrict what i buy for them partially to set the example and partially because i don't wanna buy that crap there are certain things that i will always buy like a book a special occasion outfit a souvenir on a special trip but even those things have limits and have to be reasonable there are also certain things i will never buy like robux i like to ask them the questions i think they should be asking themselves in this case i might say you can do that it's your money but also know that you won't get any more until insert allowance pay date so if something else comes up you won't have any money to buy it with is this the thing you really want with your savings i might even suggest they take a day to think about it the point here is that your kid is likely impulse spending they see a thing when they are playing the game they want it they don't yet have the skills to consider the outcome of that impulse spending with my kid it's helpful to be specific i point out places we plan to go or activities where she might also enjoy spending money sure you can buy that but i want to remind you we're going to the coast this weekend and we'll be near that candy shop you like if you don't have any money you won't be able to buy anything there do you want to think about this before you decide to buy the robux

i feel like you will get a very mixed bag of answers on this i do not restrict what my kids spend their own money one they went through their own silly purchases like robux and other games that have micro transactions my thoughts and hope that they would learn through experience and when they make mistakes when the stakes are very low it's a much better outcome than learning as young adults with real debt like credit cards as a result my kids mostly save their money these days that doesn't mean they don't have silly purchases from time to time but they don't spend everything on micro transactions anymore we have been doing this for several years now

*you* see it as a fake hat *they* see it as a cool new outfit not that my opinion matters but i dont see it any worse than spending money on extraneous physical clothes better an in game skin they'll use on and off for years than some toy they'll play with for a week and get bored of

so far my only rule is no blind bags surprise boxes over priced and they don't play with the toys that come in them otherwise my son lately wants to save his money for a trip to an arcade indoor play park

isn't it better for him to learn at age with that using all his money on something stupid is stupid for me that's the point of allowance teaching them money management at a young age when the stakes are low so they are prepared when the stakes are high it's his money you need to let him make his mistakes
make him wait a day or two if he still wants it after having to wait a few days let him it will teach him to not make impulse purchases decisions

when i was a kid my mom used to say my money burned a hole in my pocket realistically i had undiagnosed adhd and zero impulse control 🤣 as a kid who used to do the twenty years ago version of this same thing i think you should talk to him about setting up a budget that way he can save for what he wants while still having some extra robucks money maybe set him up with the envelope system it worked well for me when i was a kid since it was a visible thing get him a three ring binder with large envelopes with holes punched in them each with a label then help him figure out how much he wants to save for his bigger buy and how much he wants for extra robucks money and then maybe a third option for miscellaneous spending money for stuff like candy or little things when you’re out

of course if it's something super unhealthy dangerous or scammy i'll stop them if it's just a foolish to me purchase i'll try to dissuade them maybe give them a week to confirm their decision but if they are sure i'll let them but in the first place if they receive like at xmas or birthday depending on age i will set a limit on how much they can spend in the short term i tell the younger ones to look at the older sibling who was allowed to buy a laptop at age using savings accumulated over years plus parents and relatives all chipping in for xmas for cultural reasons my kids all have thousands of their money from gifts so i most definitely cannot let them spend it all willy nilly i am very strict on mobile in game purchases and things like robux it's a blanket no for cosmetic items and premium currency only paying for new apps games mods or new content something that adds to the play value or to remove ads from an otherwise great game is allowed i've had many conversations explaining to them how this industry works and how they exploit kids and people who are lazy addicted or have ego issues

i've struggled with this too important to note my son has adhd so i do understand that the impulsive thoughts that he *has to have it * are really strong but i wanted to encourage him to save for actual things he wants as well as to eventually learn that if he can wait the impulse out it will pass my solution was to say that he can only buy virtual currency once per school term this has been working well for us so far his savings grow till he can finally buy something meaningful but he also gets to treat himself to some robux etc several times a year

i would look for other ways to help him learn how to make monetary decisions talk him through some of your own thought processes when you purchase things and think about the terminology you use eg if you say “we can’t afford the more expensive brand of breakfast cereal” you’re inadvertently implying that if you could afford it you’d buy it which basically encourages them to always spend their money on the things you want whereas if you say “we choose not to buy the expensive brand of breakfast cereal because it is not good value we choose to save that money for other things that are more worthwhile” then you’re showing your kids how to weigh up options to spend money on things they really value

yeah i've totally said no to the robux thing usually when i explain would you rather spend euro on some makebelieve thing in roblox that you can't hold or go to the store and buy something she gets the oooh true kinda moment man i miss the days where you had to buy a game but at least then you got everything in the game without having to buy a thousand extra things

op have you made a decision on this as a kid i had a dollar weekly allowance that my parents gave me and i had the same lack of impulse control having my own money didn't mean shit to how i spent it even as an adult i have struggled to control it if i didn't stick to my budget i think the point of having that kind of control as a child is to simulate the idea of being an adult maybe plan out a trip or an event that they have to save up to with a hard deadline and if he misses it then so be it pointing out the lesson of budgeting that can be ingrained into him at a young age will be the best one thing to point out that i point out to all parents dealing with gamer children is that microtransactions are designed to take advantage of the user even those discount' items are calculated in a way to be the most enticing and best believe any data being acquired from purchase history and purchase habits will be used to manipulate the user freedom for your kids to spend their money however they want is great and all but being cognizant of the fact that they haven't developed the physiological mechanism to defend against that kind of manipulation is just as important we don't know what the effect of having everything at our fingertips has will do to the development of the human race but i wish you luck

our kids get an allowance half is paid out in cash and the other half into a savings account there’s a third “half” they don’t know about that goes into a long term savings account for someday cash can be spent on whatever they want although if i know they’re going to the store for candy i encourage them to take a limited amount and not their whole stash savings can be spent but there is a one week waiting period and either parent can veto so kid has to pick something out like a new lego set and trigger the waiting period after a week kid also has to remember they wanted that new lego set and request to go purchase order it edit gifted money is usually put into the short term savings and my younger kid occasionally brings me her cash and asks to add it to her savings too the older is always out of cash but doesn’t use her savings much because the week waiting period distracts her

tldr; we don’t allow the balance to be and no more money is allowed to be withdrawn until the next pay period usually bi weekly we also absolutely limit the amount of robux allowed it’s basically gambling practice and as such is treated like a hobby and we wouldn’t spend all our money on a hobby personally i treat it like a bank in practice for real life so essentially i have a maximum withdrawal and the balance can never be you can really argue for that last dollar but i make it clear that no money is coming to them unless it’s honorably earned my daughter started hiding money around the house to beat my system so she has some money in the bank and some in hidden spots for emergencies lol for me i base big purchases on what’s in the bank and i usually try to keep at least of what’s there so for there would have to be at least left and no more money allowed to be taken out until the next pay period we go by our literal pay periods they also have the opportunity to apply for jobs around the house if there are any garden work extra chores etc mainly trying to get kid into understanding the limits of their money i would not care where the money goes but we also went through the return vs non return like if she gets something on amazon it’s returnable and she can get her money back but clothes on roblox are lost dollars forever
at age we set boundaries no slime or stuffies we have enough it’s everywhere but birthday money or something blow it on whatever you like

our only rules are no sweets and nothing unsafe anything else is fair game to buy with allowance funny enough i don't mind at all when my daughter buys leaf tickets in animal crossing because it doesn't contribute to the clutter in her room or the mountain of plastic in the ocean unlike all those horrible lol balls 😡

we give our year old an allowance to teach him money management skills we even went as far as to loan him money and give advances on his allowance it was a good lesson he realized quickly what a mistake that was when he had to pay it back that being said he gets to spend half of his allowance on whatever he wants and half goes to the bank we do ask him to consider the difference in buying pixels vs something tangible like when he was able to buy his speed cube so when he has his eyes on something he really wants he stops spending on robux and saves for that instead

we make our kids put half in savings and they can spend the other half on whatever they choose at any time for the savings we have said that is for something big that they really want and that they have to discuss it with us before buying so we can help them find the best price and make sure it's something that is age appropriate our son has already gotten in the habit of saving almost all his money while our daughter has spent more of hers our son recently hit a small milestone with his savings and is proud of that imagining how his savings can grow and he can one day get something he really wants our daughter has noticed and now wants to catch up my only beef in the scenario you are describing is that those companies are very predatory for kids spending money i know all marketing is made to convince people to spend their money but kids aren't equipped to deal with the impulse buying that on line and in game shopping presents it feels like it's stealing money from them so i guess my two cents is make sure you are talking with him about the influence of advertising in those games and the world around him too

i have a yr old boy and a yr old girl the former is an absolute pain when it comes to chores but after repeating myself times and threatening to take away ban him from using something he’ll eventually do chores like clean the playroom or pickup his junk out of the living room my daughter is much better at listening but needs to be reminded quite a bit in terms of allowance we just started doing it starting late re my daughter i know and excuse the slight bit of self promotion but i’ve actually spent the past several months building a startup product around the idea of allowance chores kids autonomy and online shopping in the app i set a base allowance of week and then tie a series of chores weekly and one off bonuses to “micro payments” for example i currently have a weekly chore to unload the dishwasher all week which is worth ; and then i have a one off “bonus” chore for successfully completing soccer juggles so far she’s really into it and is always asking for extra stuff to do the unique thing about my product is it’s connected to an online shopping experience for kids it’s curated and categorized and kids can only spend what they have so she’s already bought herself a pop puck this fidgety toy thing and is now saving for something bigger she’s set her eyes on in the shop she loves having the autonomy to spend her savings when she wants and how she wants and as a parent i know the shopping experience is kid friendly and completely safe if anyone is interested in giving it a try themselves please send me a dm i’m currently seeking out some early beta testers

honesty she is young and she might not grasp the concept of bills and budgets not seeing money or a credit card or check might not make it click in her head that it’s money because it’s not a tangible thing for the well being of your child’s mental health and development i would stray away from punishing her with food as some have stated i would also not throw your financial status in her face explaining frugality is one thing saying now we can’t pay bills because of you is another being mindful of your lessons and how they could be interpreted by a young undeveloped mind will help some good framework for lesson learning can be “think of good deeds you can do to earn privileges” this can be behaving well using polite manners with everyone quietly doing an activity helping with housework helping put away groceries etc explaining why she cannot have the ipad until a time you deem appropriate age appropriate homework for summer enrichment maybe money or math oriented to allow for stimulation for understanding work on figuring out how it was able to happen and stop it from happening kid mode does not protect your passwords or saved payment methods so maybe that’s why is leading to it many apps allow apple pay amazon pay paypal etc you could absolutely sell the ipad for funds if necessary because clearly providing for your family is important also you could make it a password requirement for any game download and if it says in app purchases act accordingly i can see how frustrating and scary it is for you to have hundreds of dollars hanging in the balance remember it was likely not out of malice if you’re unsure of the logistics it’s likely your daughter doesn’t understand either good on you for looking for help and answers good luck

about how it all works for help remove any card info etc from the ipad before giving it back to your kid but first ask kid to show you exactly how she did manage to buy stuff online tell her you want how buying extra stuff in a game feels good at first but then there is always that next thing to buy to make it _even better_ i told my y old that i have a policy for myself when it comes to games i never want to by anything in a game i grew up with computer games that you bought on a disc you purchased your game and then it was yours i dislike even the thought of being mid game and having to choose in that moment and feeling if something is worth paying for so i have chosen to never buy anything in games i told her that i understand that roblox is different from the kind of games i used to play and some i play now so i am open to her buying robux with her own money or giving her robux giftcards as presents but i also told her i _need her to understand_ that there has to be a limit i feel like you've gotten a ton of advice on how to handle this situation but wanted to offer a little bit on how to start getting your daughter to see the value of money here's what we started with my kids and it's really helped them to understand that things cost money and that we can't just buy everything each kid gets an allowance every week that is equal to their age so my year old gets per week he has to split it between three jars literally just old peanut butter jars that i cleaned out and labeled spend weekly spending money that he can spend on anything he wants no questions asked this can be purchases in games snacks at the store goodies at school whatever save money he is saving toward some goal recently his goal with to buy super smash brothers for the switch it was and he had to save for a lot of weeks to get it giving money for any kind of charitable giving usually this goes to penny wars at school or buying school supplies for a supply drive or something but they get to decide if he gets extra money for any reason like a birthday or he does extra chores and earns some extra dollars he can decide what jar to put it in most of his birthday money went into the save jar to get his switch game for the spend money they now have to use that to buy things that i don't feel like i have to provide this might be in app purchases for games extra treats at the store pokemon cards etc i also keep a box of things for them to buy at home that i have picked up when i find them each item is marked with a price and they can ask to open the store any time they want to spend the money this has greatly reduced the amount of asking for things because they know that i'll tell them they have to buy it themselves with their money for online purchases they pay me then i buy it with my card it also teaches them how long it can take to save up for something they really want which then helps them take care of it because i won't replace it if it gets lost or broken they have to save up again they also have to use their spend money to replace things that they lose or break for example i recently bought my son a new water bottle that was bigger than his old one for soccer if he forgets that and it gets lost at the soccer field he knows that he has to pay to replace it from his spend save money i buy the first one but if he loses it he has to replace it i should also add that every other week they pay taxes which is that goes into a family tax jar that we will then use to do something or buy something that benefits the entire family this might be a family ice cream trip spending money for an amusement park etc but everyone in the family has to agree on the use of those dollars

the ability to give the ipad back with full confidence that if she was intentionally doing it she wouldn't be able to with that being said if it's in the hundreds a second time i would surely hope wanted to eat i told my dad i wanted two things off of their value menu at the time and he was blunt with me that i couldn't get both due to not having the money i was taken aback that the lowest of cost items were unobtainable my dad worked three jobs at that time to make ends meet because he had to quit his job on the coast to come back home and raise us full time from that point on i made it and this is why i bought my kid a pc instead of a tablet pc means it's connected to a microsoft account you set up the the microsoft account and you can transfer money to your kid's account and they can do what they want but seriously require a password for purchases or delete your card from the account i'd much rather go through the tedium of re entering my credit card info all the time than have to deal with purchases i didn't sanction our kid used to do this all the time with actual money he'd steal change from our change jar and it never really sunk in until one day it just did he wasn't a bad kid he just wanted stuff and it never really occurred to him that mom and dad have to work to earn the money to buy it i think i used to lie about money too there was no good reason for any of it; as gifted as i was as a child there was an element of wanting to fit in and wanting to have stuff that everyone else did and that overrides the wrongness so don't worry your kid is still a good kid but after her punishment is over you need to give her a chance to prove it one of the things i started doing was assigning my kid household chores; if he completed them he would get a small sum of money at the end of the day but rather than give it to him outright i would keep a running tab on how much i owed him this way when he wanted something he could see how much he has in theory have a moment to reflect upon why he wanted it and only then will i give him the money to buy the thing

first i am so sorry to hear about your wife my advice would be to lock your card when you do not need it set a spending cap so anything over a certain amount declines unless you authorize it i get an email for these when i have a cap set or log out of amazon and make sure the password is not saved on any devices she uses also you could enable text notifications or email notifications on purchases pretty sure you can set it for a minimal amount to inform you too i do this with my cards i get a text shortly after a charge is made telling me how much and where it was spent you can then more immediately dispute any unauthorized charges last scenario would be to unlink amazon from your payment info a pain but she wouldn't be able to do it anymore as for punishment if she stole money from anyone else she would likely have had a cop talking to her you need to tell her this is something that could get her in big big trouble i would definitely make her work around the house more than her normal chores to pay you back age appropriate chores of course i'd also really consider selling the tablet since she is proving to you that she is not mature enough for one if you have any unnecessary items unused items you could try selling them but honestly that's hot or miss you should also sit her down and discuss what a budget is and how electronic payments and physical cash works you can list out what you make per month and your bills and how much and have it show what is left over then you can explain that x is how much you should have had for the budget but because she took without asking for permission that you only have z until next payday talking finances with kids can be beneficial since it helps teach money management if your handy with excel it makes it easy to show debt to income
