as someone who has studied cognitive psychology and has spent years doing user experience design for a living my professional assessment is that most free to play games are highly manipulative at best and straight up unethical at worst waiting until she has better self control will likely be a permanent ban even most adults don't have the training to recognize all the different ways that they're being manipulated let alone have practiced strategies for overcoming social conditioning needed to resist robert cialdini has written a lot in cognitive psychology about what he's deemed principles of persuasion which are general techniques that are used to influence people's behavior here's a brief summary of the principles [ his book influence is a good read if you want to dig in a little deeper [ applying some of them to a common pattern you'll see in these types of games * if you login every day you get a free reward * sets the stage for exploiting **reciprocity** \ because they did something nice for you your instinct is going to be to do something for them by complying with what they're asking * the reward gets better each consecutive day you play * exploits **consistency** \ if you've convinced someone to do something once they're far more likely to keep doing it * the rewards reset if you miss a day * exploits **scarcity** \ when something is taken away even if it's free people instinctively perceive the cost of the loss as greater than what the item would have cost to acquire * after you get the bonus you'll presented with a limited offer to purchase something only available to the first x players y players have already redeemed * exploits **scarcity** \ seeing that it's limited makes it appear more valuable and drives instinct to acquire something before it runs out * exploits **social proof** \ seeing that a large number of others have taken the offer makes you more likely to consider it a good idea to do as well * exploits **reciprocity** \ you're far more likely to take an offer because they've given you rewards

okay well i'm glad you're getting it figured out please try to keep learning don't rely on customer service reps to teach you that's not really their job especially an amazon employee trying to explain how an apple product works try to avoid using terms like kid mode and learn the actual terms for specific protections and what they mean by googling or asking questions two step verification wouldn't stop someone from making a purchase; two step verification refers to a protection that would stop someone from logging in to your account even if they learned your password your daughter didn't need to do that because you were already logged in i still think you need to consider the possibility that your daughter is the victim of a gift card scammer chatting with her and telling her to buy gift cards if that happened it's possible your daughter never even got any of the robux she tried to buy or didn't even realize she was using your account she may have thought she was just doing a favor for her friend in the game it's not super likely but there are some red flags that mean you shouldn't rule it out the fact that this happened suddenly it was a fairly elaborate scheme and it was hundreds of dollars instantly with no testing the waters makes it super suspicious you also didn't mention your daughter ever asking you to buy her robux before it would be one thing if your daughter kept asking you for robux and finally worked up the nerves to get it herself and if that's what happened then you're probably fine but if not you might be shooting yourself in the foot by punishing her for being the victim of a scammer you probably shouldn't have let her have unmonitored access to an app that lets her chat with strangers in the first place but she will interact with more people who want to take advantage of her in the future if she was being manipulated the whole thing is probably very confusing to her especially if you don't realize she was the victim of a scammer either

stop buying stuff just stop period sit her down and tell her that you want to teach her and her brother lessons about being thankful for the things she has and that you won't be buying anything new for her or her brother unless it's necessary school stuff for example or a special occasion birthdays easter whatever when she whines and cries and throws a fit remind her this is one of those lessons instead of buying something new let's talk about the cool things we already have you'll like get something about how nothing she owns is cool and then it's time to bring out the big black bags ok when we get home we'll put all the stuff you think isn't cool in big black garbage bags and get it out of your room we're still not buying anything new though i'd also remind them of expectations and put consequences to the actions let them know before you go into the store each time we're not buying toys today we're only buying groceries or before playing roblox you can play but if you ask me about payday or buying things the game is going away then follow through you have to follow through on everything or the boundary is a fantasy and kids know that as a sidenote if this is still an issue months from now i signed the family up to volunteer for toys for toys one year when my kiddo was being particularly greedy he had to help give away so many toys and he saw how happy it made people he was yo and it helped some but there was still work to be done lol

instead of buying everything for my son i ask him if he wants to put it on his birthday list of the time it's a yes the other he's like naw i don't want it that bad this is a tip i read on reddit when he was a baby and it has worked out really well he's now he gets the acknowledgement that i heard him and we can write it down then about a month before his birthday we go over the list to see if he still wants it side note sometimes i don't write it down and we forget it was ever said don't tell him

you need to start asking her if she has money for that if not then that sucks i guess shes not getting it this is actually a very good opportunity to teach her economics responsibility and consequences economics if she wants stuff she can start doing chores around the house for a little bit of cash a dollar or so a day to get her list checked off find a list of age appropriate chores she can do and pay her at the end of the week responsibility she can pay for the things she wants or she can save up for it consequences if she doesn't do her chores she doesn't get paid good luck

my kids have “chore money” that they get every week once they complete their jobs and honestly that helped so much if they wanted something in the store i’d just ask them if they had enough for it if they didn’t they had to save up for it and for big things i’d say “ooh put that on your birthday christmas list ” it’s okay to say no to kids the things that they think they “need” are usually just wants of course in some cases like if we were grocery shopping i’d let them choose one kind of fruit they liked or their favorite yogurt or something but they learned to not expect me to buy them whatever they wanted

start by giving a reasonable weekly allowance a rate that grows as they age tell her that you will pay for essentials clothing and food and all of the important stuff you will also be giving gifts at holidays and birthdays anything outside of that both children should purchase themselves then stick to your word anytime she asks for something say you are welcome to buy that with your own money kids need to be prepared to become adults part of that is understanding that things cost money and money comes from labor you are not a money tree and you are already paying for everything and probably have a wish list of your own giving your children the responsibility of managing money allows them to learn that skill and appreciate the costs of different items

my dad was big on no new stuff til x date and that worked well generally something like christmas birthday last day of school as for pay day i think you can gently explain that when you get paid your first priorities are the house food and clothes and pay day doesn't necessarily mean fun stuff for you or her

it’s a great thing for kids to start managing their own money my parents did this we were not given an allowance for doing regular chores because they wanted us to understand that chipping in with the housework was a part of life but if we wanted to earn money they would always find something “extra” that we could do to earn it they would also find ways to give us money instead of other things for example…an easter egg hunt where the eggs have dimes and quarters in them instead of candy…also a good way to reduce candy consumption when going to the store our parents would give us money usually but that was a long time ago to get whatever we want if we complained that it wasn’t enough for what we wanted it was taken away and we didn’t get anything we learned very quickly to be happy with what we got and not complain

and if she is rude about it then the one thing goes back on the shelf and she waits until next week and just so you know she'll be fine not getting anything at the store i hardly ever get my kid stuff at the store and she's totally used to that

alternately you could offer her xx per month and tell her she can spend it however she wants but when it’s gone that’s it nothing else you’d be surprised how quickly year olds understand money at least mine did they got a month each and a quick math lesson on how much that was per day to be honest i still do this but now they get much bigger amounts at & almost and because they know how to budget they are responsible for clothing purchases gifts and extras money is a finite resource the sooner kids realize that the better
yes my daughter gets a week she was proud to save up for some thing in roblox

i was going to suggest this as well we just instituted an allowance for both of mine it's per year of age per week so the y o gets per week the y o gets per week and they have to split it between spend to spend on whatever they want save saving up for a goal and giving giving to a charity or helping others the y o puts in each jar the y o puts in each jar and then puts her extra dollar where ever she wants every other week they each pay a tax as well that goes into a family jar to pay for a fun family thing like saturday ice cream or a movie this has greatly cut down on the whining for things because if they want something they have to use their to get it my y o is a saver so she rarely spends all her spend money but the y o spends it as soon as he gets it but then he knows he doesn't get anything else until the next week for money they get as gifts they can choose where to put it surprisingly it's often save

i would never tie a reward or allowance to chores it sets up the child to expect something every time they lift a finger in our house everyone is expected to contribute to the running of the household my son does get money and we will buy him things but those come independent of chores he is expected to do his chores everyday without being paid for them just like his father and i if he doesn’t fill the dishwasher the natural consequence is we don’t have clean dishes and he has to wash them by hand if he doesn’t do laundry we can’t go to the park and play if he wants me to be free to have fun then he has to help with getting stuff done

letting kids pay for half of weekend trip i have two kids ages and this summer they have had a ridiculously successful lemonade stand they’ve averaged each day they’ve done it which has been about twice a week this summer they also get paid much less to do chores around the house so far they’ve spent their chore money each week on their own roblox or the ice cream truck but have a combined over saved from their lemonade stand our money was a little tight this summer because we’re getting ready to move we’re not struggling but vacation wise we haven’t done more than a few day trips and one weekend camping trip in years past we’ve also done a weekend trip to an amusement park about hours away with lodging that includes an indoor water park my kids have recently asked if we would be doing that again this year and i told them it’s not in the budget this year but maybe in the spring a few days ago they came to me and asked if they could pay for this years trip i’m really on the fence about it on one hand my husband and i could pay for half the trip to basically cover ourselves paying for half the trip would eat about half of their savings and we could offer to pay them back with an extra trip in the spring or just straight up cash they also don’t need the money for anything they already have savings accounts and i would rather them spend the money on a trip than candy or more toys that they don’t need on the other hand i feel like i’m exploiting my children would you let your kids contribute towards a vacation

i think it’s impressive they are offering and i think that would be a great way to show them how to earn money save it and use it on something positive plus i like the idea of adding an extra trip in the spring to basically say thank you for contributing to our family’s success kudos to you for raising great kids
i would let them do this but then when money is less tight put equal or greater amounts into each of their s
i think it's a good idea it teaches them the value of money and how to earn it and save it up for something they want great job on raising successful entrepreneurs from a lemonade stand is amazing

i think it’s a great life lesson to have kids choose what they spend their money on i loved saving up my allowance chore pay for big things like video game systems and bicycles at a week it took a long time but was very rewarding

i would let them help and i would have them help plan the trip choosing restaurants choosing activities learning about budgeting for a trip and how much things cost they should spend their money however they want and if this is what they choose i think it's really great that they place so much value on family vacations that they don't want to miss out on one personally i would also secretly funnel the money they contributed back into their bank accounts when you have the money to do so because i would want to reward my kids for their good saving habits as well as their generosity in offering to help pay you aren't exploiting them because they came to you and asked to do this as long as they are included in the planning process and fully understand how much money they're spending and what exactly it's going towards i don't see a problem

don't think of it as taking advantage of your kids think of it as allowing them to experience the deep pride of being able to work earn save and then spend money they worked hard now let them reap the rewards i'd wager that they'll remember this trip as one of the best because they made it happen

here are various things they can use their money on paying for the materials that went into making the lemonade or at least doing that going forward if they are making day learning to save charity an experience a thing if they aren't already i would definitely make do going forward if they continue to make day but i wouldn't do it retroactively they should definitely save a percentage of what they earned the idea is to require them to save it for at least some period of time we generally use months and only use it for something special which is negotiable a percentage of their money should be donated to a cause or causes they believe in pair that with volunteering if you can once you get to spending i think it's great to teach a child the value of an experience which is what your kids are proposing even better they are learning to contribute financially to a family which is another important financial lesson so i love this idea once they've saved and donated obviously some things are needed and others are worth it but this is a bottom of the list choice note i fully understand that this approach requires a certain level of financial means and does not work for everybody but i think op is somebody who this could work for

sneakerhead dad checking in my hobby has me way more in touch with the minds of people less than half my age than i ever thought possible so i might be able to help there's a few different but similar things going on here in terms of levels of authenticity legit these are pairs that are authentic and made by the manufacturer obtained either directly from the manufacturer from an authorized retailer like foot locker or champs etc or from a trusted rd party reseller or reselling platform these are the real deal and what the next type is trying hard to replicate to various degrees of success fake replica reps these are bootleg pairs that are manufactured by replica factories for the purpose of looking as close to indiscernible from the real thing as possible again to various degrees of success to be caught with these or even accused of wearing these can be very embarrassing sometimes younger sneakerheads or hype beasts will accuse someone just because they can't believe that other kid was able to obtain the real thing because of how hard to get a specific hyped pair might be personally i could care less if someone wears replicas knockoffs these seem to be what you're describing pairs that are manufactured by alternative brands to resemble or suggest the appearance of more popular styles and brands but do not replicate the logos or exact designs for a kid looking to show off a bit these wouldn't get the job done and could definitely be the cause of some teasing or verbal abuse by their peers those are the big ones my suggestion for buying on a budget would be especially for converse check the outlets the back walls are filled with pairs on clearance that are the real deal also check for larger brands but less popular pairs you're still getting the branding if that's what's important to them but since there won't be as much hype there's much more chance of these being on sale

as a sneakerhead obvious fakes are really frowned upon we can talk about how in the end it doesn't matter what brands you wear if you *want* to wear a brand and you end up wearing an obvious knockoff it just looks really bad there are tons of really good looking knockoffs reps though that will pass the onceover test unless you're really versed in the shoe but i don't think there are many converse reps as the shoes are already general release and easily purchaseable if the issue is cost then i really think it's a matter of either not caring about brands and just getting something that is functional or finding sales

this may be unpopular to say but i think you should hear an honest take you may want to avoid buying fake brand name anything ever under any circumstance for many reasons white label or store brands can be fine but deliberate knockoffs are almost always a poor decision they tend to be foreign knockoffs with no quality control or environmental regulation employ child labor use cheaper sometimes unsafe materials and other very problematic aspects you don’t seem to be considering if you don’t want to spend the money on a certain brand of item then simply look to a brand item that fits in your budget without “pretending” to be something that it isn’t there’s no shame in wearing a basic reebok shoe or last seasons basic nike shoe on clearance if that’s where your budget is there are good quality shoes at every price point that aren’t cheap knockoffs just expand to less popular brand names and be open to less stylish or outdated models your son won’t be mocked for wearing a clean pair of adidas or nike shoes that you bought on a off sale or off a clearance rack at a shoe store or from an outlet store wearing a “fake” nike shoe or a fake anything else is grounds for being poked at kids don’t have filters they tend to *say* what adults would keep as gossip behind the curtain wearing knockoff apparel sends the message that you aren’t living within your means don’t value quality or craftsmanship don’t have self confidence or are seeking external validation it’s not a good look in any scenario save up for the real thing like your edit suggests is a much better path to take or change to something more affordable and within your means even if it isn’t the one you really want or the one that’s in style shameless knockoffs are always going to be a bad look a waste and will get you your kids judged by others

i use to collect name brand shoes wear and stock them and sometimes never wear them sounds stupid right i used to think that having name brand shoes would differentiate yourself from everyone else and made you feel special the ignorant idea of feeling special or different definitely blew a hole in my pocket and now i care less about it this idea was probably summed up from not getting it from my parents since they were so busy in life i still love my parents but knowing this and now a dad i would voice it and make them feel special by telling them they look great or cool or 🔥 haha and teaching them that its not about the big brands it's all about just looking nice and being confident and that usually starts off from us as parents i mean today i would wear a white shirt from walmart target jeans from amazon and a pair of nonbrand white shoes i make sure my hairs cut and i smell good and if my hair looks scrubby that day i wear a hat but still feel confident all in all my rule of thumb will definitely be if you look good you'll feel good i will double down on this and help teach them about saving money for better things like a trip or maybe having a savings jar so they can see what they saved and buy in the future and if they really want to buy a name brand shoes with their savings they can i'm sorry you went through this event kids are definitely mean rude and irresponsible but i'm sure your child still loves their shoes parents don't have to be perfect we just have to show our children the realness and authenticity of today's world

no she could run to grandma and even though grandma knows i said no she would say yes sometimes when kylee would get in trouble for misbehaving grandma would argue with me along with kylee trying to defend her i bought kylee an iphone for her birthday a few years back and wanted a debit card to put on file so she could down load certain apps i told her she can't use my debit card because she is a grandma if she could get a monthly subscription to an app using her card i said no because grandma is on a fixed income and can't afford to pay monthly subscriptions but grandma says yes this leads to extra charges and grandma having to call the bank and cancel her card i tell her not to let kylee add her card to her phone again but she doesn't listen grandma let's kylee add her card to her phone again although i told them both she is not allowed to do this this time it leads to kylee signing back up for the subscription with grandma's permission and using grandma's card to buy roblox also with grandma's permission grandma forgets she allowed roblox about worth throughout the month some as a christmas present and didn't calculate it in her budget then comes up short on money at the end of the month and cancels her bank card gets refunded the money but has to wait for a new card accept for this time i make kylee pay back half of the money well last night not even two weeks after grandma got her new card in the mail i find out she let kylee put her card on her iphone again and let kylee sign up for a free trial on her phone as long as she cancels the membership before her card is charged nobody said anything to me about this and now has been charged to grandma's card from apple because kylee thinks you cancel a subscription if you delete the app she has no idea what she was doing so after the trial is up grandma gets changed for the subscription after kylee leaves to school grandma comes up to me and says she doesn't know how we are going to do this if she should make as a music teacher myself i would not recommend that any of my students do lessons twice a week once a week for an hour okay for some students it doesn't give them enough time to practice and imo compounds the issue of getting stuck on the same piece in my experience the biggest obstacles to practicing and improvement are not having a fun element to their lessons or to their practicing practicing incorrectly and trying to practice too much or trying to cram practicing shorter amounts of time practicing daily are better than longer amounts occasionally i would suggest talking to their teacher if you haven't already about good practice habits if they're just playing through the entire piece over and over for example it won't help them get better lastly practice sessions should always end with something fun a piece they have already mastered and enjoy playing their own composition a popular song they like etc good luck

i give my year old allowance weekly he has chores during the summer time he rides on the mower and will do some gardening with me and my outdoor chores and he will help maintain the living regular common areas grades are a given along with keeping a clean room and doesn’t get rewarded for that he cannot dip below a b i do believe if he’s working for his money and he decides how to spend it he recently saved up and bought a switch lite he has also blown a lot of his cash on fortnite and minecraft and has been disappointed especially when weve went to the target or something and he’s wanted something and i refused to buy it it’s been a lesson for him on how to properly save his money and not buy something because it initially looks good i also did this same thing with my now year old who has a part time job it’s worked for us

i let my year old blow of gift money on minecraft coins and other in app game purchases… now every single time he wants something he doesn’t have money for i remind him of that he doesn’t have anything to show for the other day he had he earned doing a lemonade stand and we were at a resale shop that had toys he got so many toys he could play with over and over i praised him for being wise with his money and said “now think of what you could have done with that ” his eyes got real big with all of the possibilities that he wasted was worth all of the lessons learned from wasting his money he’ll still spend some of his money on in app purchases but he gives himself a limit “i’m only going to spend on it instead of my whole ” for example i think spending money unwisely and then not having money to spend on other things you want is still a very important lesson in learning the value of a dollar

tell me again why he gets an allowance in the first place i didn't get one when was a kid if i wanted money i had to earn it maybe i'm old fashioned but that did teach me the value of money

if she doesn’t know it can make her serious money and you want to consider her well being and have her continue to do something she likes without thinking about money is there a way you can monetize the channel and take the money and put it away for her into some sort of investment account or a high interest savings account that she can access later i think if she’s really good at it and is getting a lot of views followers it would be worth monetizing and saving that money for her since life is expensive and only getting more expensive honestly not sure how you’d go about it in the future if she knew she was making a ton of money and wanted to start using it so that’s something to consider either way that’s awesome and congrats to her she deserves to be paid and her talents could really get her somewhere

also ask in personalfinance personally i’d suggest monetizing it but be very careful is she anonymous if so take steps to improve anonymity never mention name location school city etc ensure her account is not easily traceable etc if not anonymous it’s not a deal breaker but be careful even more important is mentally this is probably something that is short term will stop making money in months or a year it is extremely important for you to embrace that and not push her to continue it or blame her once the viewers and money falls off let her keep being a child financially set up a account at fidelity or similar the account is in your name with her as beneficiary she can spend it on college tuition room and board computers also trade school private school it can also be used to fund her roth ira up to k invest in a target date fund for the year she turns inside the roth ira if she earns more than some amount for example years of expenses at a state university allowing for growth above that invest in a different account

monetize it quietly if you can make an account for her don't have her think about ups and downs with the money don't make it a thing if she gets treat her to something amazing disney day or something if she's raking in thousands put that money aside let her know later hey when you were a kid you made a bunch of money and give it to her to give her a leg up at a stage in life why say no to money

just my perspective monetize it but don't let your child know that you are doing so at this time she doesn't need to know at years old that way it will still be fun i'd keep her name off of everything possible online to provide as much anonymity as possible as for the finances personally i'd put them in long term investments tied into a trust if this has the potential to be as successful as you think it might it would be worth setting it in trust with options for withdrawl for specific items like education and other necessities related to advanced education ie technology a vehicle travel etc naming you as trustee with full distribution at that way she won't squander it on fun stuff before it is used for the things that will actually give her a brighter future i've seen too many people blow windfalls quickly i remember a teen in college who spent most of an inheritance on buying friendships drinks all around concert tickets etc and i've seen adults spend a million inheritance in a few short years living off of it instead of investing it and allowing it to continue growing in that situation they were almost broke by retirement and struggling to make mortgage payments the best thing you can do for her is tying it up and teaching her about personal finance so when she does take it over she has the skills to continue to grow the money

i would absolutely monetize the channel and get an accountant to answer any tax questions i would have all the money earned would be saved towards my child’s retirement imagine years of compound growth just for doing something that brings you absolute childhood joy schooling and otherwise invested for their future at she may not care about money but it’s a perfectly fine age to start learning about it she can also get a say in how she invests it like buying roblox stock though she should also learn that buying individual stocks is a highly risky endeavor that should constitute only a small percentage of a portfolio that is heavily invested in broad market index funds and get a real head start in terms of her financial literacy and well being so proud of your kid for you op make some and if your daughter finds that she doesn’t like it then she should have control over when to end the monetization

if you monetize it and it sells i would suggest you set up a trust fund realize you could be talking about a few hundred dollars or tens of thousands of dollars technically she wouldn't be earning money you will according to google's rules i wouldn't be afraid to use that money for her upbringing and expenses as well a trust fund is a good idea because it can be managed imagine giving an year old child on their birthday how many good financial decisions are they going to make and how soon before the money is simply gone people that age are just starting to truly learn about money and expenses side note i've seen couples in their 's receive a windfall and its gone in two months in summary upbringing college savings investments trust fund

i took piano lessons for years have been playing on and off for years now i'm not amazing at it but it's consistently brought me joy i genuinely don't understand what the problem is with continuing lessons even if he doesn't have time to practice outside of that he's still learning new things and keeping up with something he seems to enjoy the tips that others have given about providing music that he enjoys and modeling practicing yourself despite your wife's complaints are good and all but i don't agree with this implicit idea that the lessons are only worth it if he's good enough to go to competition or play professionally later on if you have the disposable income why not let him set the terms for how much to keep up with playing if he still likes to

your wife needs to butt out she's getting way too involved in something that isn't about her your kid's friend's progress has nothing to do with your kid's progress motor development is a big part of musical skill and you don't know how else your kid's friend has been developing skills not only that but it *makes sense* for a kid to make rapid progress over their first year of learning because they learn the easy stuff first also your wife is probably *not* privy to the aspects of music that the friend is struggling with if she's seen him play or is going based on the friend's parents' bragging that will be focussed on the friend's strengths not his weaknesses she can't discourage you from playing and then expect him to play if you want him to value it you guys need to value it if you want him to practice the absolute best thing you can do is to model practicing and practicing bringing joy i'm tired is also sometimes a psychological defense mechanism against wasting energy on something he might be struggling with something like a musical skill he hasn't mastered but is required for the piece he's working on and need periods of deep rest to try to get it work can be happening in the brain even if it doesn't look like it don't make him stop his lessons just to punish him for not practicing the why am i wasting money on your piano lessons when you don't practice nonsense frames money spent on lessons as something that your wife expects to get a return on rather than something done for its own sake he's getting something out of his lessons so unless you're actually hard up due to them let him continue speaking of such any theory that he is learning in his piano lessons is probably being transferred to his violin playing which might explain why he's ahead

the decision is on him but he will have to make the decision either he practices or he quits the lessons doesn't mean he can't play the piano without the lessons maybe be thinks if he quits he won't be able to play anymore maybe he wants to play whenever he wants and doesn't care much about the lesson

let the natural consequences be the measure of success if he doesn’t improve over his past performance then he is demonstrating in action that he is not interested enough in the subject to pay for further participation lessons if he does improve then continue with the lessons this is a model that will spill into just about anything he commits to sports extra curriculars college courses jobs… actions always speak louder than words so if he will decide through his own actions no matter what he says

i agree here i find that a lot of kids reach the point where they enjoy playing an instrument because making music is enjoyable and fun but don't have a lot of motivation to practice for further improvement because they can largely do what they want to do decreasing the frequency of lessons lets him enjoy making music without feeling the need to progress his skills faster than he wants to dedicate himself to right now
